bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext: Description of problem: umlgraph is not functional Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): umlgraph-5.7.2-13.fc24.noarch How reproducible: yes Steps to Reproduce: 1. dnf install umlgraph 2. LC_ALL=C java -jar /usr/share/java/umlgraph.jar 3. Actual results: Error: no main manifest attribute, in /usr/share/java/umlgraph.jar Expected results: umlgraph starts and works. Additional info: Though java packaging guidelines tell to remove META-INF/MANIFEST.MF, we should keep information about main class with entry point and not exclude the complete META-INF folder from the package. https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Java#No_class-path_in_MANIFEST.MF
Fix is needed for all Fedora versions and EPEL7.

Fedora 23 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-12-20. Fedora 23 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug. If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug. Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
umlgraph-5.7.2-15.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-351b037780
umlgraph-5.7.2-15.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2a137e45f8
umlgraph-5.7.2-15.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-a156955f36
